intro: Mapania polystachya, commonly known as the long-stalked mapania, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is a shrub that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Mapania polystachya is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
